metadata.title: CVE-2020-17541 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Libjpeg-turbo all version have a stack-based buffer overflow in the"transform" component. A remote attacker can send a malformed jpeg file tothe service and cause arbitrary code execution or denial of service of thetarget service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-17541` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1+esm2
libjpeg-turbo-test - 1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1+esm2
libjpeg-turbo8 - 1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1+esm2
libturbojpeg - 1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1+esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libjpeg-turbo package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.0-0ubuntu2.1+esm2').
